name: 11.14 "It's a Mad, Mad, Mad, Mad Bar" Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who came back in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Robin Colcord.

	Robin was Rebecca's old boyfriend. A couple of seasons prior, she left him at the altar because he was no longer rich.

questions.text: What was different about the man who returned?
options: He was working in Las Vegas now.
questions.explanation:
He was a poor man.

	Robin gave away his six million dollars.  He took a vow of poverty.

questions.text: What did Rebecca call the guys at Cheers?
questions.explanation:
Poor, pathetic, boring losers.

	She was convinced that Robin was still rich. She believed he'd take her away from Cheers and she'd be rich too.

questions.text: Who did Frasier think was back?
questions.explanation:
Lilith.

	He went on and on about how Lilith wanted him back. Then when Cliff told him it was Robin Colcord, Frasier said, "Good, I wouldn't take that broad back if you paid me."

questions.text: What did the gang think was hiding somewhere in Cheers?
questions.explanation:
A money belt.

	Robin hid six million dollars in a money belt under the desk last time. He said he always hid them in pairs.

questions.text: Where did the person who came back hide money belts when he hid them?
questions.explanation:
In duct work.

	First Frasier called Robin pretending he had some valuables to hide. Next, Cliff called Robin claiming he found a money belt and wanted to see if it was Robin's.

questions.text: What did the man say he had to wash out in the bathroom sink?
questions.explanation:
Underwear.

	Robin only had the clothes off his back. Rebecca just could not grasp that he was poor. She even thought he hid a money belt in her apartment.

questions.text: Who did the gang at Cheers suspect got the money belt?
questions.explanation:
Fire captain.

	Captain Dobson retired six months ago because he came into some money. Carla had her kids hold up the man. He kept saying, "what are you doing?"

questions.text: What did the man who came back call Rebecca?
questions.explanation:
A selfish golddigger.

	She pretended to care about Robin to get his money. Robin told her again he was poor and had no desire to be rich ever again. He said sometimes he shoplifted and begged just to get food.

questions.text: Was there a money belt at Cheers?
questions.explanation:
No.

	Robin told them they turned on each other because of greed. He said he wanted them to learn what money did to people, plus, he said, "I never really liked you."
